headline.main: Wireless Charging Inches Ahead as Two Industry Groups Merge
headline.print_headline: Wireless Charging Inches Ahead as Two Industry Groups Merge

docs.lead_paragraph: Two of three global industry groups vying to establish a dominant standard for wireless charging technology have agreed to merge, bringing consumers a small step closer to throwing away their smartphone power cords.
docs.snippet: Two of three global industry groups vying to establish a dominant standard for wireless charging technology have agreed to merge, bringing consumers a small step closer to throwing away their smartphone power cords....

headline.main: AP Source: Knicks Sending Smith, Shumpert to Cavs
headline.print_headline: AP Source: Knicks Sending Smith, Shumpert to Cavs

docs.lead_paragraph: The New York Knicks are trading J.R. Smith and Iman Shumpert to the disappointing Cavaliers, who have struggled in superstar LeBron James' first season back in Cleveland.
docs.snippet: The New York Knicks are trading J.R. Smith and Iman Shumpert to the disappointing Cavaliers, who have struggled in superstar LeBron James' first season back in Cleveland....

headline.main: Australia Battles to Contain Worst Wildfires in 30 Years
headline.print_headline: Australia Battles to Contain Worst Wildfires in 30 Years

docs.lead_paragraph: Hundreds of firefighters were battling on Tuesday to contain Australia's worst wildfires in 30 years which have already swept across more than 12,000 hectares outside the southern city of Adelaide and destroyed at least 26 homes.
docs.snippet: Hundreds of firefighters were battling on Tuesday to contain Australia's worst wildfires in 30 years which have already swept across more than 12,000 hectares outside the southern city of Adelaide and destroyed at least 26 homes....

headline.main: Sony CEO Praises Employees, Partners for Standing Up to Hackers
headline.print_headline: Sony CEO Praises Employees, Partners for Standing Up to Hackers

docs.lead_paragraph: Sony Corp Chief Executive Officer Kazuo Hirai on Monday praised employees and partners of the company's Hollywood movie studio for standing up to "extortionist efforts" of hackers who attacked Sony Pictures Entertainment in November.
docs.snippet: Sony Corp Chief Executive Officer Kazuo Hirai on Monday praised employees and partners of the company's Hollywood movie studio for standing up to "extortionist efforts" of hackers who attacked Sony Pictures Entertainment in November....

headline.main: CES: A Push for Higher Resolution and Better-Looking TVs

docs.abstract: Samsung, Sony and other big TV makers are showing off sky-high display resolutions and marking content partnerships in a bid to push ultrahigh definition into the mainstream.
docs.snippet: Samsung, Sony and other big TV makers are showing off sky-high display resolutions and marking content partnerships in a bid to push ultrahigh definition into the mainstream....

headline.main: Trial in Former W.Va. Coal CEO's Case Delayed Until April
headline.print_headline: Trial in Former W.Va. Coal CEO's Case Delayed Until April

docs.lead_paragraph: A judge has delayed the trial of a former West Virginia coal baron facing criminal charges in connection with a 2010 mine explosion that killed 29 men.
docs.snippet: A judge has delayed the trial of a former West Virginia coal baron facing criminal charges in connection with a 2010 mine explosion that killed 29 men....

headline.main: China Approves 20 IPOs, Steps Up Pace as Market Rallies
headline.print_headline: China Approves 20 IPOs, Steps Up Pace as Market Rallies

docs.lead_paragraph: China's stock market watchdog has approved the initial public offerings of 20 firms, it said late on Monday, around double the number it approved on average last year.
docs.snippet: China's stock market watchdog has approved the initial public offerings of 20 firms, it said late on Monday, around double the number it approved on average last year....

headline.main: UK Regulator to Fine London Unit of Banco Espírito Santo-WSJ
headline.print_headline: UK Regulator to Fine London Unit of Banco Espírito Santo-WSJ

docs.lead_paragraph: Britain's Financial Conduct Authority plans to fine the investment banking unit of the failed Portuguese lender Banco Espirito Santo SA for violating listing rules, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing two people familiar with the matter.
docs.snippet: Britain's Financial Conduct Authority plans to fine the investment banking unit of the failed Portuguese lender Banco Espirito Santo SA for violating listing rules, the Wall Street Journal reported, citing two people familiar with the matter....

headline.main: U.S. Stands by Plan to Pull Troops From Afghanistan
headline.print_headline: U.S. Stands by Plan to Pull Troops From Afghanistan

docs.lead_paragraph: The United States on Monday stood by plans to halve the number of its troops in Afghanistan this year and reduce them further in 2016 following Afghan President Ashraf Ghani's suggestion that President Barack Obama review his deadline.
docs.snippet: The United States on Monday stood by plans to halve the number of its troops in Afghanistan this year and reduce them further in 2016 following Afghan President Ashraf Ghani's suggestion that President Barack Obama review his deadline....

headline.main: Police Investigate as Photo Shows Detective, Suspect Posing
headline.print_headline: Police Investigate as Photo Shows Detective, Suspect Posing

docs.lead_paragraph: Guam police have launched an internal investigation after a photo began circulating online showing a detective posing with a suspect accused of punching an infant.
docs.snippet: Guam police have launched an internal investigation after a photo began circulating online showing a detective posing with a suspect accused of punching an infant....
